description: Initiates a connection to a target (for example, a managed node) for a Session Manager session. Returns a URL and token that can be used to open a WebSocket connection for sending input and receiving outputs.

parameters.name: Target
parameters.description: The managed node to connect to for the session.

parameters.name: Parameters
parameters.description: The values you want to specify for the parameters defined in the Session document. For more information about these parameters, see Create a Session Manager preferences document in the Amazon Web Services Systems Manager User Guide. (string) --- (list) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: TokenValue
nested_items.description: An encrypted token value containing session and caller information. This token is used to authenticate the connection to the managed node, and is valid only long enough to ensure the connection is successful. Never share your session's token.

nested_items.name: StreamUrl
nested_items.description: A URL back to SSM Agent on the managed node that the Session Manager client uses to send commands and receive output from the node. Format: wss://ssmmessages.**region**.amazonaws.com/v1/data-channel/**session-id**?stream=(input|output)
